intro: Seseli amomum, commonly known as wild chervil, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist meadows and woodland edges. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Its seeds are used in some traditional culinary applications, though it is not as widely cultivated as other members of its family. The plant has a mild, anise-like fragrance and is sometimes used in herbal teas.
